column1: beijingbabes 160549390356 "2017-05-11 13:33:45 GMT" https://beijingbabes.tumblr.com/post/160549390356/hyuna-doesnt-like-being-physically-affectionate "fyhyunah:    Q. You formed your new unit Triple H with E'Dawn and Hui. How do you feel?Hyuna: I feel great to form a new unit with the Pentagon members
column2: who are the future of Cube Entertainment. Some people say Cube uses me to promote them
column3: but I have a lot to learn from them too. I was very nervous when I was preparing for Triple H‚Äôs first album.Q. What‚Äôs your relationship with the two young members?Hyuna: They might feel uncomfortable being with me
column4: but we try to take care of each other. I think we‚Äôre still trying to find common ground.Q. You appeared on Music Core and Inkigayo last week. Were you satisfied with your performance?Hyuna: Even though I appeared on only two music chart shows because music chart shows these days are not that popular
column5: I love my costume with a floral pattern. And it‚Äôs fun to wink too. I didn‚Äôt know I‚Äôm that much cute
column6: haha.   Q. It‚Äôs notable that you acted in Triple H‚Äôs music video.Hyuna: It‚Äôs meaningful to me
column7: but I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm good at acting. I‚Äôm still nervous when I sing on stage even though it has been 10 years since debut
column8: and I think I should concentrate on singing rather than acting.Q. There many idols who cross the line between singing and acting
column9: though.Hyuna: My father dreamed of becoming an actor
column10: and that‚Äôs why he made me take auditions to be an actress when I was young. But I failed about 50 auditions
column11: haha. People say I‚Äôm really talented
column12: but I‚Äôm not. I just could improve my ability thanks to my father and agency
column13: and I‚Äôm still trying to learn. My father is the one who always supports me. When I caught in a controversy
column14: he doesn‚Äôt worry about it or try to console me. Instead
column15: he just says ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs my girl. She did so great that many people speak ill of you‚Äù.Q. Triple H‚Äôs music video is caught in a controversy because it has some suggestive scenes.Hyuna: Well
column16: I just tried not to be nervous
column17: and I wanted to express what the director wanted. I wanted to try something new. Actually
column18: I don‚Äôt like being physically affectionate. I like to have physical contact with girls. Anyway
column19: I‚Äôll try to calm the controversy by showing great performance on stage.Q. It has been 10 years since your debut. How do you feel?Hyuna: I feel more responsible now. When I debuted
column20: there were only 5 staff members in Cube Entertainment. Some people say I‚Äôm the Cinderella or breadwinner of Cube
column21: but I think I‚Äôm Cube‚Äôs first daughter. I‚Äôve been following Cube‚Äôs growth for many years
column22: and I hope to earn a lot of money because I really want to make my staff members happy. Q. Is there anything changed after 4minute has been disbanded? Hyuna: I think my activity as a member of Triple H is an extension of my activities as a member of 4minute and Trouble Maker. One thing has changed
column26: and I felt like I was being chased by many things. But these days
column27: I became more comfortable. I mean
column28: I appreciate the small things now. I found true happiness.Q. What‚Äôs your goal?Hyuna: When I was very young
column29: I imitated Psy‚Äôs dance moves on the stage of Dongdaemun market. But I later became the heroine of his music video. Well
column30: I think I‚Äôm very lucky. There were many good people around me
column31: and I was loved by so many people. I don‚Äôt follow my dream anymore. Instead
column32: I‚Äôll work hard and try not to miss a good opportunity. And I‚Äôll try to do my best in return for my fans‚Äô love.   cr:¬†kpopbehind " False text

column1: beijingbabes 156869737726 "2017-02-06 02:00:19 GMT" https://beijingbabes.tumblr.com/post/156869737726/anti-personality-test  True link

beijingbabes 156631432536 "2017-01-31 17:03:33 GMT" https://beijingbabes.tumblr.com/post/156631432536/a-yale-history-professors-powerful-20-point "maneth985: sandalwoodandsunlight:  Americans are no wiser than the Europeans who saw democracy yield to fascism
column2: Nazism
column3: or communism. Our one advantage is that we might learn from their experience. Now is a good time to do so. Here are twenty lessons from the twentieth century
column4: adapted to the circumstances of today: 1. Do not obey in advance. Much of the power of authoritarianism is freely given. In times like these
column5: individuals think ahead about what a more repressive government will want
column6: and then start to do it without being asked. You‚Äôve already done this
column7: haven‚Äôt you? Stop. Anticipatory obedience teaches authorities what is possible and accelerates unfreedom. 2. Defend an institution. Defend an institution. Follow the courts or the media
column8: or a court or a newspaper. Do not speak of ‚Äúour institutions‚Äù unless you are making them yours by acting on their behalf. Institutions don‚Äôt protect themselves. They go down like dominoes unless each is defended from the beginning. 3. Recall professional ethics. When the leaders of state set a negative example
column9: professional commitments to just practice become much more important. It is hard to break a rule-of-law state without lawyers
column10: and it is hard to have show trials without judges. 4. When listening to politicians
column11: distinguish certain words. Look out for the expansive use of ‚Äúterrorism‚Äù and ‚Äúextremism.‚Äù Be alive to the fatal notions of ‚Äúexception‚Äù and ‚Äúemergency.‚Äù Be angry about the treacherous use of patriotic vocabulary. 5. Be calm when the unthinkable arrives. When the terrorist attack comes
column12: remember that all authoritarians at all times either await or plan such events in order to consolidate power. Think of the Reichstag fire. The sudden disaster that requires the end of the balance of power
column15: is the oldest trick in the Hitlerian book. Don‚Äôt fall for it. 6. Be kind to our language. Avoid pronouncing the phrases everyone else does. Think up your own way of speaking
column16: even if only to convey that thing you think everyone is saying. (Don‚Äôt use the internet before bed. Charge your gadgets away from your bedroom
column17: and read.) What to read? Perhaps The Power of the Powerless by V√°clav Havel
column19: The Captive Mind by Czes≈Çaw Milosz
column21: The Origins of Totalitarianism by Hannah Arendt
column22: or Nothing is True and Everything is Possible by Peter Pomerantsev. 7. Stand out. Someone has to. It is easy
column24: to follow along. It can feel strange to do or say something different. But without that unease
column25: there is no freedom. And the moment you set an example
column26: the spell of the status quo is broken
column27: and others will follow. 8. Believe in truth. To abandon facts is to abandon freedom. If nothing is true
column28: then no one can criticize power
column29: because there is no basis upon which to do so. If nothing is true
column30: then all is spectacle. The biggest wallet pays for the most blinding lights. 9. Investigate. Figure things out for yourself. Spend more time with long articles. Subsidize investigative journalism by subscribing to print media. Realize that some of what is on your screen is there to harm you. Bookmark PropOrNot or other sites that investigate foreign propaganda pushes. 10. Practice corporeal politics. Power wants your body softening in your chair and your emotions dissipating on the screen. Get outside. Put your body in unfamiliar places with unfamiliar people. Make new friends and march with them. 11. Make eye contact and small talk. This is not just polite. It is a way to stay in touch with your surroundings
column32: and come to understand whom you should and should not trust. If we enter a culture of denunciation
column33: you will want to know the psychological landscape of your daily life. 12. Take responsibility for the face of the world. Notice the swastikas and the other signs of hate. Do not look away and do not get used to them. Remove them yourself and set an example for others to do so. 13. Hinder the one-party state. The parties that took over states were once something else. They exploited a historical moment to make political life impossible for their rivals. Vote in local and state elections while you can. 14. Give regularly to good causes
column34: if you can. Pick a charity and set up autopay. Then you will know that you have made a free choice that is supporting civil society helping others doing something good. 15. Establish a private life. Nastier rulers will use what they know about you to push you around. Scrub your computer of malware. Remember that email is skywriting. Consider using alternative forms of the internet
column35: or simply using it less. Have personal exchanges in person. For the same reason
column36: resolve any legal trouble. Authoritarianism works as a blackmail state
column37: looking for the hook on which to hang you. Try not to have too many hooks. 16. Learn from others in other countries. Keep up your friendships abroad
column38: or make new friends abroad. The present difficulties here are an element of a general trend. And no country is going to find a solution by itself. Make sure you and your family have passports. 17. Watch out for the paramilitaries. When the men with guns who have always claimed to be against the system start wearing uniforms and marching around with torches and pictures of a Leader
column39: the end is nigh. When the pro-Leader paramilitary and the official police and military intermingle
column40: the game is over. 18. Be reflective if you must be armed. If you carry a weapon in public service
column41: God bless you and keep you. But know that evils of the past involved policemen and soldiers finding themselves
column43: doing irregular things. Be ready to say no. (If you do not know what this means
column44: contact the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum and ask about training in professional ethics.) 19. Be as courageous as you can. If none of us is prepared to die for freedom
column45: then all of us will die in unfreedom. 20. Be a patriot. The incoming president is not. Set a good example of what America means for the generations to come. They will need it.  this is really good
column47: especially if you‚Äôre from the US." False link

column1: beijingbabes 155003966121 "2016-12-27 02:42:04 GMT" https://beijingbabes.tumblr.com/post/155003966121/my-dad-was-killed-on-christmas-eve "deseyuhooman:  Hey Tumblr fam. I‚Äôm sharing my GoFundMe. I wish I could gather myself to write a great post but I can‚Äôt.  To keep it short
column2: on Christmas Eve a reckless driver hit my dad while he was blowing leaves. He was cleaning up the front area of our neighborhood and a speeding driver hit him. I love my dad. I was his shadow. I also live with him.  I‚Äôm a college student who of course doesn‚Äôt make enough to bury my father
column3: with no insurance
column4: and to keep our house. I‚Äôm raising funds for our home and the burial.  I‚Äôm struggling right now because I was out there after it happened. I saw him die. I‚Äôm struggling. column1: beijingbabes 153565740211 "2016-11-23 18:01:04 GMT" https://beijingbabes.tumblr.com/post/153565740211/click-here-to-support-help-me-stay-out-of-an "swdyww: helpandsupportblog: GoFundMe Donations YouCaring Donations Hey everyone
column2: I had originally put this up and then taken it down within a few hours because I didn‚Äôt feel safe but I‚Äôve removed some personal info from the donation sites and put this up on an anonymous blog because I‚Äôm starting to panic a lot in terms of how I will get things done. As I mentioned I am more than willing to talk about this situation to those who are looking to help out in any way they can
column3: it‚Äôs a really heavy situation for me so I couldn‚Äôt write all about it here. That wouldn‚Äôt be possible. I‚Äôm putting this up because I recently ran away from the mentally and physically abusive household I was raised in. Finally
column4: after enduring abuse and trauma daily for as long as I could remember
column5: I was able to flee from that nightmare. I am a 24 y/o woc from a South Asian Muslim household from Montreal. Last week after work
column6: instead of returning back home I ran away because I found the opportunity that I had been waiting for all of my life. Because that moment was so sudden
column7: I left with nothing but the clothes on my back
column8: my phone and my wallet. I now have to recover all of my legal documents
column9: eyewear and my retainers which I absolutely need all of which I absolutely need. I come from a stereotypical strict
column10: horrendously restrictive and misogynistic Muslim household where I was discouraged to grow independent. It hurts a lot because my family fills a stereotype that I really hate of muslims and south asians but unfortunately my family just is regressive in every sense. I was controlled and abused by all sides of my family and I was taught the only way out was through an arranged marriage with a stranger. As a result I have no formal education
column11: because my family did not allow me to study because they didn‚Äôt want me to be financially independent or in any way educated about the real world. The toxic environment I was forced to stay in fed my depression and anxiety and I wasn‚Äôt able to get help for this even at my worse
column12: I had no family to turn to and was not allowed friends to speak to on these matters that weren‚Äôt already ingrained in the same society. When I would feel extremely suicidal. I wasn‚Äôt allowed to receive any help as mental illnesses are not taken seriously in our family and community. I was forbidden to leave the house at any time out and do anything that I needed to do without fear of violence or abuse because of how restrictive my family was with me. I had to be in bed by 11 pm
column13: and my phone was locked away by my parents until she allowed me to use it again during the day. I could not be out of the house unless it was for school or light errands and I was only allowed to study what my mother allowed me to study which were fields where I couldn‚Äôt see a future for myself in. Her idea was that I rely on an arranged marriage and husband to do take full responsibility of me; that I always remain dependent. There is a history of misogyny with my mother
column14: and since she had more girls that she ever wanted
column15: I being the youngest one was too much for her to love and instead of just letting me go or kicking me out she used me as a means of control for what she lacked in life
column16: even though I loved her dearly. Keep reading Hey if you guys can help pls do so if you can‚Äôt pls reblog this is a horrifying position to be in" False link
